title: Performance regression when getting multiple connections with `r2d2::Pool`
body:
## Setup

### Versions

- **Rust:** rustc 1.62.0-nightly (e85edd9a8 2022-04-28)
- **Diesel:** v2.0.0-rc0
- **Database:** postgresql
- **Operating System** Linux 5.17.3-arch1-1

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:** ["postgres", "r2d2"]

## Problem Description

As is reported in #3144, performance regression is observed when upgrading `diesel` from `v1.4.8` to `v2.0.0-rc0`. Aggregation queries (e.g. `count(*)` are particularly affected, while the performance hit on normal queries is minimal.

### What are you trying to accomplish?

### What is the expected output?

The performance of `v2.0.0-rc0` should be on par with `v1.4.8`.

### What is the actual output?

`cargo bench` output of `table.filter(id.eq(1)).count().get_result()`:

| hash | setup | perf |
|---|---|---|
| [d0bbda8](https://github.com/heyrict/diesel-aggr-sample/tree/d0bbda8a7066cf9b310e3beed2eece6418faeec9) |diesel 1.4 + r2d2| 185,936 ns/iter (+/- 15,282) |
| [599c492](https://github.com/heyrict/diesel-aggr-sample/tree/599c4923f1832fbafaaac33e6df75f6db8815e84) |diesel 2.0 + r2d2| 1,388,410 ns/iter (+/- 158,035) |
| [d3c23ba](https://github.com/heyrict/diesel-aggr-sample/tree/d3c23ba13a3202e59e28e0525a5cc7f0f40f461c) |diesel 1.4 - r2d2| 103,562 ns/iter (+/- 2,997) |
| [58d1210](https://github.com/heyrict/diesel-aggr-sample/tree/58d1210e65ac3ba2dc7e52b5b77853d323c23f9f) |diesel 2.0 - r2d2| 109,238 ns/iter (+/- 5,887) |

### Are you seeing any additional errors?


### Steps to reproduce

The minimal reproduction sample is [here](https://github.com/heyrict/diesel-aggr-sample).
